Subject: Linux clients crashing
Description:
Hello,
Our Linux clients, which are on the newest version of EPP-client, are crashing when our users browse to a repo directory on their machine and syncing. When they go to sync, the entire computer kernel panics.

One of our users has reported that running a sync with trace logging works (he thinks throttling it makes a difference) and disabling parallelization also works around the issue. This is just extra information to help our case.

Thanks!
Danny
Next_Steps__c:
27Jan: Asked R&D to provide test client. Fix is planned for 5960.
---
23Jan: Chased R&D + raised priority.
---
Raised ADO. Waiting on R&D.
---
Waiting on meeting with Cristian to raise ADO.
---
Waiting on customer to send us the logs.
Solution_Comment__c:
Customer confirmed that the below client resolved the issue:
https://download.endpointprotector.com/linux_agent/EPPLinux_v2.4.4.1004/EPPClient_ubuntu_18.04_v2.4.4.1004_x86_64.tar.gz
